item.description:
The Goethe-Institut Boston and the Coolidge Corner Theatre are pleased to present new films from Germany highlighting young directors who, with their first or second features demonstrate that there is more to New German Cinema than The Lives of Others. Sunday Matinees showcase a sampling of new and award-winning German films rarely shown outside Europe.

Ticket Price: All $5 (Can't beat that!)

About Nacht vor Augen:
Twenty-five-year-old David (Hanno Koffler) returns to his home village in the Black Forest from a Bundeswehr (German Army) mission in Afghanistan. His girlfriend Kirsten (Petra Schmidt-Schaller) and his mother are overjoyed to see him safe and well and his shy eight-year-old brother is full of admiration for him. But David is close-mouthed, brusque, and not the same man he was before the mission. He is plagued by an inner turmoil; he canâ€™t get the war he has left behind out of his head and nobody wants to hear about it. Only his young brother who begs David to become his soccer coach, gets a glimpse of the horror when the sports training quickly turns violent.

In her feature debut, Bertele succeeds in laying bare the psychic conditions and traumas of her protagonist and to show unconscious mechanisms of suppression. (2008, Germany) dir. Brigitte Maria Bertele, DVD 102 min

After the film we'll go to an area restaurant for discussion.

Hope to see you there!
Lisa
